item.dc:creator: @ThatOneServer Mike_
item.description:
@ThatOneServer wrote:

If you have a login system, it is easy to add a users online page.

First, add an integer to the end of your members table. Name it “sitelastaction” and give it a limit of 255.
Add this snippet to the beginning of your document: (Please read the code and fill in anything that needs to be filled)

<?php
$time = time();
$time15 = time() + (15 * 60);
				$mysql = mysql_query("UPDATE `DATABASE`.`TABLE` SET `sitelastaction` = ".$time." WHERE `TABLE`.`MEMBERID` ='".$_SESSION['dbid']."' LIMIT 1 ;");
?>

Now, add this snippet where you wish for your list to be: (Please read the code and fill in anything that needs to be filled)

[code]<?php
$mysql = mysql_query(“SELECT * FROM TABLE WHERE sitelastaction >= '”.$time15."’ ORDER BY RIGHTSVARIABLE ASC") or die(mysql_error()); //if you do not have a variable for your users rights, remove the whole order by section.
while($row = mysql_fetch_assoc($mysql)){
$color = “#33ff00”;
/if($row[‘mgroup’] == 4 || $row[‘mgroup’] == 6) //User rights example. Uncomment and change for use.
$color = “yellow”;
if($row[‘mgroup’] == 7)
$color = “white”;/

echo ‘’.$row[‘USERNAMEVARIABLE’].’, ';
}
?>[/code]
